words.example: The information should be accessible to everyone.
words.definition: Easy to approach or enter.

words.example: There was a serious accident on the highway.
words.definition: An unforeseen and unplanned event or circumstance.

words.example: The flowers were artificially colored.
words.definition: In a manner that is not natural or genuine; in a made-up or manufactured way.

words.example: The car was traveling at high speed.
words.definition: Moving quickly.

words.example: The door opens automatically.
words.definition: By itself or by a mechanism without direct human control.

words.example: Basically, we need more time.
words.definition: In the main or essential part; fundamentally.

words.example: He had to slam on the brakes.
words.definition: A device for slowing or stopping a moving vehicle, wheel, or axle.

words.example: She was in a cheerful mood.
words.definition: Noticeably happy and optimistic.

words.example: Climate change is a global issue.
words.definition: A long-term change in the average weather patterns that have come to define Earth’s local, regional and global climates.

words.example: They are experimenting with cloud seeding to increase rainfall.
words.definition: The process of spreading either dry ice or, more commonly, silver iodide aerosols into the upper part of clouds to try to stimulate the precipitation process and form rain or snow.

words.example: I have a long commute to work.
words.definition: Travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.

words.example: Please confirm your attendance.
words.definition: State with assurance that a particular fact or piece of news is true.

words.example: They signed a new contract.
words.definition: A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.

words.example: She is a foreign correspondent for a major newspaper.
words.definition: A journalist reporting on news from a particular place.

words.example: The ship has a large crew.
words.definition: A group of people who work on and operate a ship, aircraft, etc.

words.example: The main crop in this region is wheat.
words.definition: A cultivated plant that is grown as food, especially a grain, fruit, or vegetable.

words.example: There has been a decrease in sales.
words.definition: Become or make smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

words.example: The building has facilities for people with disabilities.
words.definition: A physical or mental condition that limits a person's movements, senses, or activities.

words.example: Driverless cars are being tested.
words.definition: Not having or needing a driver; operated by computer.

words.example: I have my driving test next week.
words.definition: An examination of a person's ability to drive a motor vehicle safely.

words.example: The photographer used a drone to take aerial shots.
words.definition: An unmanned aircraft or ship guided by remote control or onboard computers.

words.example: The drought has affected the crops.
words.definition: A prolonged period of abnormally low rainfall, leading to a shortage of water.

words.example: The old books were dusty.
words.definition: Covered with dust.

words.example: They decided to explore the forest.
words.definition: Inquire into or discuss a subject or issue in detail.

words.example: The weather conditions were extreme.
words.definition: Very great in degree or intensity.

words.example: There was a fire in the building.
words.definition: The rapid oxidation of a material in the exothermic chemical process of combustion, releasing heat, light, and various reaction products.

words.example: The country is experiencing a severe heatwave.
words.definition: A prolonged period of excessively hot weather.

words.example: He felt helpless in the situation.
words.definition: Unable to help oneself; dependent on others.

words.example: She has a very imaginative mind.
words.definition: Having or showing creativity or inventiveness.

words.example: Who is in charge here?
words.definition: Having control or authority.

words.example: The pilot was in control of the aircraft.
words.definition: Having the power to direct or manage something.

words.example: There was an increase in the number of students.
words.definition: Become or make greater in size, amount, or degree.

words.example: He injured his leg playing football.
words.definition: Do physical harm or damage to (someone).

words.example: Instant messaging is a popular way to communicate online.
words.definition: A type of online chat which offers real-time text transmission over the Internet.

words.example: Please don't interrupt me when I'm speaking.
words.definition: Stop the continuous progress of (an activity or process).

words.example: There was an accident at the junction.
words.definition: A point where two or more things are joined.

words.example: Heavy rain caused a landslide.
words.definition: The sliding down of a mass of earth or rock from a mountain or cliff.

words.example: Stay in your lane while driving.
words.definition: A division of a road marked off with painted lines and intended for a single line of vehicles.

words.example: The meteorological office issued a weather warning.
words.definition: Relating to meteorology, the branch of science concerned with the processes and phenomena of the atmosphere, especially as a means of forecasting the weather.

words.example: We took the motorway to get there faster.
words.definition: A broad road, built for fast traffic over long distances, with few places for vehicles to get onto it.

words.example: She has a musical talent.
words.definition: Relating to music or musicians.

words.example: Nowadays, many people work from home.
words.definition: At the present time, in contrast with the past.

words.example: You should only overtake when it's safe to do so.
words.definition: Catch up with and pass while travelling in the same direction.

words.example: You can park your car over there.
words.definition: Bring a vehicle to a halt and leave it temporarily in a particular place.

words.example: The book is in my possession.
words.definition: The state of having, owning, or controlling something.

words.example: This is a very practical solution.
words.definition: Concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas.

words.example: We need to prevent accidents from happening.
words.definition: Keep (something) from happening or arising.

words.example: Wear a helmet to protect your head.
words.definition: Keep safe from harm or injury.

words.example: The doctor checked his pulse.
words.definition: A rhythmical throbbing of the arteries as blood is propelled through them, typically as felt in the wrists or neck.

words.example: The area has high annual rainfall.
words.definition: The amount of rain, snow, etc. that falls in a particular place within a given period.

words.example: The batteries are replaceable.
words.definition: Able to be replaced.

words.example: Seasonal fruits are often the tastiest.
words.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a particular season of the year.

words.example: There is a shortage of water due to the drought.
words.definition: A scarcity or lack of something.

words.example: He has excellent communication skills.
words.definition: The ability to do something well; expertise.

words.example: I'll slip out while nobody is watching.
words.definition: Leave a place quietly or quickly so as not to be noticed.

words.example: She is a very sociable person.
words.definition: Willing to talk and engage in activities with other people; friendly and outgoing.

words.example: We need to address social issues.
words.definition: Relating to society or its organization.

words.example: The speed limit on this road is 50 km/h.
words.definition: The maximum speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on a particular stretch of road.

words.example: He gripped the steering wheel tightly.
words.definition: A wheel-shaped device used to steer a vehicle.

words.example: They celebrated the traditional festival.
words.definition: Relating to or characteristic of long-established customs, practices, or ideas.

words.example: I was stuck in a traffic jam for an hour.
words.definition: A long line of vehicles that are moving very slowly or not moving at all.

words.example: We went on a vacation to a tropical island.
words.definition: Relating to or situated in the tropics.

words.ru: нетрудоспособный (в контексте поиска работы), непригодный для работы
words.example: Due to his lack of skills, he was deemed unemployable.
words.definition: Not able to be employed.

words.example: He earns good wages at his new job.
words.definition: A fixed regular payment, typically paid on a daily or weekly basis, made by an employer to an employee, especially to a manual or unskilled worker.

words.example: This jacket is washable.
words.definition: Able to be washed without shrinking or losing color.

words.example: The weather pattern has been unusual this year.
words.definition: The weather conditions prevailing in an area over a long period.
